result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett M Baumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4.5 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any addictive substances of any kind, even with a prescription, specifically Xanax.

Do not drive unless properly licensed and have agent's permission.  No contact with A.M.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Brett M Baumann in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
BTC:  Defendant is to return receiver box to ZCI within 2 days.
  Jury trial scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
ZCI
ZCI
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  Exceptions are going to court and meeting with an atty. This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 05-06-2014: Defenant is allowed to attend treatment at Roger's Memorial Hospital-Chemical Dependency Services in Kenosha, WI. The defendant shall be released from house arrest Tuesday, May 6 for the appointment to begin at 5:30 pm. The appointment should be completed by 9:00 pm. The Defendant shall also be released to attend the treatment program on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm and Saturdays from 9:00 am to 12:00 pm. The duration of the program is 4 to 6 weeks. The Defendant shall communicate with ZCI regarding the specific start date and completion date of the program upon receiving specific information.

**ELM MAY BE REMOVED. DEFENDANT TO BE TESTED WEEKLY BY ZCI OR IF TESTED THROUGH TREATMENT, RESULTS ARE TO BE SHARED WITH ZCI**

Defendant Brett M Baumann in court with attorney Mark D Richards.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense is asking for ELM to be removed. The State takes no position

BTC: Bond modification is granted. Modify bond to remove ZCI. Deft to be tested weekly by ZCI or testing through treatment if shared with ZCI.
